title: How to Make the Most out of Your PSP

steps.headline: One of the easiest ways (and the only legal one as well!)
steps.description:
to get more out of your PSP is to download the most recent firmware. Each release usually has a useful feature, such as some explained here! Download the newest PSP update by going on settings and go to network update but you must have an AC adaptor. these updates are always running so you must check network update constantly. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: The PSP comes with the ability to connect to the Internet via Wi-Fi.
steps.description:
So if you have a wireless router that has an internet connection within range you can connect to the Internet with your PSP. All the features in the Network or the PlayStation Network sections of the menu can't be used without an active internet connection. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Built-in into the PSP is an Internet Browser so you can surf websites
Using the PlayStation Store, you can download games, their demos, rent or buy videos and even download wallpapers and themes if your firmware version allows for custom themes.
steps.description:
A PlayStation Network account is required in order to use the PlayStation Store. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-728px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":249,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"394","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: The latest firmware also allows you to access Skype via the built-in app accessible via Network menu.
steps.description:
You need a Skype account in order to use Skype. But luckily, you can sign up for it directly from the app! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: You can use a camera to take photos and videos and then view and share them on the PSP
steps.description:
You need to buy the camera separately. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-596px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":201,"bigWidth":"596","bigHeight":"261","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: The PSP offers tons of other features including Internet Radio and RSS Channel!

text:
One of the easiest ways (and the only legal one as well!) to get more out of your PSP is to download the most recent firmware. Each release usually has a useful feature, such as some explained here! Download the newest PSP update by going on settings and go to network update but you must have an AC adaptor. these updates are always running so you must check network update constantly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The PSP comes with the ability to connect to the Internet via Wi-Fi. So if you have a wireless router that has an internet connection within range you can connect to the Internet with your PSP. All the features in the Network or the PlayStation Network sections of the menu can't be used without an active internet connection. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/76/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Built-in into the PSP is an Internet Browser so you can surf websites Using the PlayStation Store, you can download games, their demos, rent or buy videos and even download wallpapers and themes if your firmware version allows for custom themes. A PlayStation Network account is required in order to use the PlayStation Store. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/8b/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/aid286518-v4-728px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":249,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"394","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The latest firmware also allows you to access Skype via the built-in app accessible via Network menu. You need a Skype account in order to use Skype. But luckily, you can sign up for it directly from the app! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/ac/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} You can use a camera to take photos and videos and then view and share them on the PSP You need to buy the camera separately. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/36/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/aid286518-v4-596px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":201,"bigWidth":"596","bigHeight":"261","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The PSP offers tons of other features including Internet Radio and RSS Channel! Enjoy your newfound PSP abilities!
sentences: One of the easiest ways (and the only legal one as well!)
to get more out of your PSP is to download the most recent firmware.
Each release usually has a useful feature, such as some explained here!
Download the newest PSP update by going on settings and go to network update but you must have an AC adaptor.
these updates are always running so you must check network update constantly.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/3a\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} The PSP comes with the ability to connect to the Internet via Wi-Fi.
So if you have a wireless router that has an internet connection within range you can connect to the Internet with your PSP.
All the features in the Network or the PlayStation Network sections of the menu can't be used without an active internet connection.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/76\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Built-in into the PSP is an Internet Browser so you can surf websites Using the PlayStation Store, you can download games, their demos, rent or buy videos and even download wallpapers and themes if your firmware version allows for custom themes.
A PlayStation Network account is required in order to use the PlayStation Store.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/8\/8b\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-728px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":249,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"394","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} The latest firmware also allows you to access Skype via the built-in app accessible via Network menu.
You need a Skype account in order to use Skype.
But luckily, you can sign up for it directly from the app!

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/a\/ac\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-533px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":269,"bigWidth":"533","bigHeight":"312","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can use a camera to take photos and videos and then view and share them on the PSP You need to buy the camera separately.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid286518-v4-596px-Make-the-Most-out-of-Your-PSP-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":201,"bigWidth":"596","bigHeight":"261","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} The PSP offers tons of other features including Internet Radio and RSS Channel!
